sentence.Network_en: His ancestral home is in France.
He is the stereotyped monster of the horror films and the adventure books, and an obvious ( though not perhaps strictly scientific ) link with our ancestral past.
sentence.Network_cn: 它们是恐怖电影和惊险小说中的老一套的怪物, 并且与我们的祖先有着明显的 ( 虽然可能没有科学的 ) 联系.

sentence.Network_en: The Magnoliales are not seen as an ancestral group.
sentence.Network_cn: 木兰目不能看作是一个祖先类群.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English : from Old French ancestrel, from ancestre (see ancestor)

entry.def: You use ancestral to refer to a person's family in former times, especially when the family is important and has property or land which they have had for a long time.

example.ex: ...the family's ancestral home in southern Germany.
example.tran: 这个家族在德国南部的祖居

means.word_mean: 1. inherited or inheritable by established rules (usually legal rules) of descent;
2. of or belonging to or inherited from an ancestor

Sentence.sentence: Our ancestral selves miss the natural world and long for contact with non-human life.
